description:
Fix the gdb path for NDK-r8b.

- Removed android.toolchain property.
- Added android.gdbserver property.
- Changed property-location to check the both file and directory's existence.

TBR=jam
BUG=

Committed: http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=155108

messages.text:
https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10823435/diff/1/content/shell/android/java/content_shell_apk.xml
File content/shell/android/java/content_shell_apk.xml (right):

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10823435/diff/1/content/shell/android/java/content_shell_apk.xml#newcode20
content/shell/android/java/content_shell_apk.xml:20: <fileset file="${toolchain.dir}/../../../../../prebuilt/android-arm/gdbserver/gdbserver"/>
I imagine this won't work for x86 apks. What about passing in a platform-specific variable
There are too many duplicated gypi code for ant, will file a bug to refactorying it.

PTAL

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10823435/diff/1/content/shell/android/java/content_shell_apk.xml
File content/shell/android/java/content_shell_apk.xml (right):

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10823435/diff/1/content/shell/android/java/content_shell_apk.xml#newcode20
content/shell/android/java/content_shell_apk.xml:20: <fileset file="${toolchain.dir}/../../../../../prebuilt/android-arm/gdbserver/gdbserver"/>
On 2012/08/21 19:47:40, Yaron wrote:
> I imagine this won't work for x86 apks. What about passing in a
> platform-specific variable

Done.

+Peter as this can impact webkit build.

http://codereview.chromium.org/10823435/diff/8001/build/android/envsetup_functions.sh
File build/android/envsetup_functions.sh (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/10823435/diff/8001/build/android/envsetup_functions.sh#newcode110
build/android/envsetup_functions.sh:110: DEFINES+=" target_arch=ia32 ndk_target_arch=x86 use_libffmpeg=0"
I don't think you need this new variable at all. Look at build/common.gypi. It looks like the variable is already being re-written from ia32 to x86 and you can just use target_arch.

It would be good to just simplify that if it's indeed true.l

http://codereview.chromium.org/10823435/diff/8001/content/content_shell.gypi
File content/content_shell.gypi (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/10823435/diff/8001/content/content_shell.gypi#newcode667
content/content_shell.gypi:667: '-DANDROID_TARGET_ARCH=<(ndk_target_arch)',
It looks like the ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN is only ever used to get the right gdbserver. You could consolidate this variable with the existing one instead of adding an extra.

http://codereview.chromium.org/10823435/diff/8001/content/shell/android/java/content_shell_apk.xml
File content/shell/android/java/content_shell_apk.xml (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/10823435/diff/8001/content/shell/android/java/content_shell_apk.xml#newcode20
content/shell/android/java/content_shell_apk.xml:20: <fileset file="${toolchain.dir}/../../../../../prebuilt/android-${ndk.target.arch}/gdbserver/gdbserver"/>
Actually I don't think you can do this in one change because the variable won't be defined for the webkit apk targets. (e.g. third_party/WebKit/Tools/DumpRenderTree/DumpRenderTree.gyp/DumpRenderTree.gyp and there are two others).

I think you need to define the gyp variable in envsetup and in chromium gyp. A separate change in webkit gyp and then add this target once those are both landed.

Actually, there are 3 files need to change in Webkit, I'd like get the right solution for this, then land the WebKit CL first.

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10823435/diff/8001/build/android/envsetup_functions.sh
File build/android/envsetup_functions.sh (right):

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10823435/diff/8001/build/android/envsetup_functions.sh#newcode110
build/android/envsetup_functions.sh:110: DEFINES+=" target_arch=ia32 ndk_target_arch=x86 use_libffmpeg=0"
On 2012/08/22 22:51:35, Yaron wrote:
> I don't think you need this new variable at all. Look at build/common.gypi. It
> looks like the variable is already being re-written from ia32 to x86 and you can
> just use target_arch.
> 
> It would be good to just simplify that if it's indeed true.l

Agreed. If it turns out you do, please name it "android_ndk_target_arch", as "ndk" can be ambiguous.

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10823435/diff/8001/content/shell/android/java/content_shell_apk.xml
File content/shell/android/java/content_shell_apk.xml (right):

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10823435/diff/8001/content/shell/android/java/content_shell_apk.xml#newcode20
content/shell/android/java/content_shell_apk.xml:20: <fileset file="${toolchain.dir}/../../../../../prebuilt/android-${ndk.target.arch}/gdbserver/gdbserver"/>
On 2012/08/22 22:51:35, Yaron wrote:
> Actually I don't think you can do this in one change because the variable won't
> be defined for the webkit apk targets. (e.g.
> third_party/WebKit/Tools/DumpRenderTree/DumpRenderTree.gyp/DumpRenderTree.gyp
> and there are two others).
> 
> I think you need to define the gyp variable in envsetup and in chromium gyp. A
> separate change in webkit gyp and then add this target once those are both
> landed.

We can pass defines/properties to ant without things breaking if they aren't being used yet, so in this case a WebKit change can land first, after which (when WebKit rolls into Chromium) this should be fine to land.

I'm a bit concerned about the number of level-ups ("../") this line relies on. For clarity, also exporting ANDROID_NDK_ROOT may be better, but that would indeed increase the number of defines even more. The repetition of invocating and passing all the arguments is too common now, can we consolidate this even more to a single gypi?

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10823435/diff/8001/content/shell/content_shell_ant_helper.sh
File content/shell/content_shell_ant_helper.sh (right):

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10823435/diff/8001/content/shell/content_shell_ant_helper.sh#newcode9
content/shell/content_shell_ant_helper.sh:9: # A helper script to help convert the values of the fifth parameter for
fifth -> last?

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10823435/diff/8001/content/shell/content_shell_ant_helper.sh#newcode13
content/shell/content_shell_ant_helper.sh:13: buildtype="$(echo "${12}" | tr '[A-Z]' '[a-z]')"
buildtype="$(echo "${@: -1}" | tr '[A-Z]' '[a-z]')"

would make this much less fragile.

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10823435/diff/8001/content/shell/content_shell_ant_helper.sh#newcode19
content/shell/content_shell_ant_helper.sh:19: "${11}"
exec "${@:1:$((${#@} - 1))}"

and when we want to add buildtype:
exec "${@:1:$((${#@} - 1))}" "${buildtype}"

The real problem is, however, that this stinks. We should be passing the build type as the first parameter instead of the last one, as that would allow us to use "shift" to remove it. The script would end up as something like:

buildtype="$(echo "${1}" | tr '[A-Z]' '[a-z]')"
shift
exec $@ "${buildtype}"

PTAL

> "ndk" can be ambiguous.

Done.

I agreed and will file a bug for refactoring this part.

hi, I think the file 'testing/android/native_test_apk.xml' should also be changed for gdbserver, like content/shell/android/java/content_shell_apk.xml
Thanks, changed two more xml files.

lgtm

But please make sure Peter's happy. Also, I'm not entirely sure how you're planning to deploy this. I think that as Peter mentioned, you can land a webkit change first that defines both ANDROID_GDBSERVER and ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN in gyp, then land this change and when it rolls into webkit, remove the redundant ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN.

http://codereview.chromium.org/10823435/diff/6006/build/android/envsetup_functions.sh
File build/android/envsetup_functions.sh (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/10823435/diff/6006/build/android/envsetup_functions.sh#newcode95
build/android/envsetup_functions.sh:95: DEFINES+=" target_arch=arm"
Nit: remove the duplicate "target_arch" assignment from each of these and move to L125.

http://codereview.chromium.org/10823435/diff/6006/build/java.gypi
File build/java.gypi (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/10823435/diff/6006/build/java.gypi#newcode63
build/java.gypi:63: '-DANDROID_TOOLCHAIN=<(android_toolchain)',
Why is ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN still specified? Is this for webkit?

Could you take another look?

I will split this CL, to do the three-way process for WebKit change.

Removed

On 2012/08/25 00:14:14, Yaron wrote:
> Why is ANDROID_TOOLCHAIN still specified? Is this for webkit?
SGTM, but please land 10886046 first and then rebase this one.
Landing this after the webkit change was rolled in.
